item.title: Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA)
item.description: FINRA is a self-regulatory organization, meaning itâ€™s not part of the government, but a non-profit organization which is designated by the government to be an examining authority. A designated examning authority is expected to regulate its own members, and inspects their books and records.
